title: SCiP Comics
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:scpedia]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

##blue|SCiP Comics##[[footnote]]Read further to acquire more information regarding this topic.[[/footnote]], (affectionately known as "Skip Comics") represent a collection of hilariously lackluster comic strips found within the ##blue|SCP Foundation##'s[[footnote]]Idk, I just wanted to add a footnote.[[/footnote]]internal network, ##blue|SCiPNet##[[footnote]]SCiPNet, nicknamed SkipNet, is the intranet and database of the SCP Foundation.[[/footnote]]. Crafted by the infamous ##blue|Dr. Avenlee##[[footnote]] Yours truly.[[/footnote]], these comics boast a unique blend of minimal effort and maximum amusement.

@@ @@

[[=]]
SCiP Comics
[[/=]]

[[=]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[/=]]
----
[[image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/art:scip-comics/Signature]]
[[=]]
Dr. Avenlee's signature
[[/=]]
[[/div]]

With their rudimentary illustrations and barely one-page narratives, SCiP Comics exemplify the epitome of low-budget entertainment within the Foundation's clandestine archives. Dr. Avenlee's creative genius—or lack thereof—shines through in each panel, offering a delightful glimpse into the world of anomalous entities and Foundation personnel through the lens of unapologetic mediocrity.

Accessible through SCiPNet's labyrinthine database, SCiP Comics serve as a welcome distraction from the seriousness of containment procedures and research endeavors. Despite—or perhaps because of—their abysmal quality, these comics have garnered a cult following among Foundation employees, who eagerly await each new installment for a hearty dose of laughter and disbelief.

While hardly sanctioned by the SCP Foundation, SCiP Comics have nonetheless cemented their place in Foundation lore, embodying the spirit of "##blue|so bad, it's good##" entertainment. Their enduring popularity speaks volumes about the Foundation's ability to find humor in even the most mundane and poorly executed of endeavors, proving that even in the darkest corners of the anomalous world, laughter can still be found.

@@ @@
@@ @@
//"I made these using my last two braincells, please enjoy them to your heart's content." –Dr. Avenlee//
@@ @@
